titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Frederick A. Dugas papers, 1825-1848
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, September 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Deeds, mercantile accounts, and personal letters of a French-American family. Several of the letters are in French. Included also is a record of visits, charges, and payments kept in diary form in 1854 by Louis Alexander Dugas (1806-1884), a prominent physician of Augusta, Ga. Information about the Habersham Iron Works in Habersham County, Georgia is also included.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Frederick A. Dugas Papers, 1825-1848, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Deeds, mercantile accounts, and personal letters of a French-American family. Several of the letters are in French. Included also is a record of visits, charges, and payments kept in diary form in 1854 by Louis Alexander Dugas (1806-1884), a prominent physician of Augusta, Ga. Information about the Habersham Iron Works in Habersham County, Georgia is also included.
